title: Tyler Scott
text:
Tyler Scott, (born September 21, 1985 in <a href="Windsor%2C%20Ontario">Windsor, Ontario</a>) is a <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a> in the <a href="Canadian%20Football%20League">Canadian Football League</a> who last played for the Edmonton Eskimos. He attended the <a href="University%20of%20Western%20Ontario">University of Western Ontario</a> as a <a href="geography">geography</a> <a href="Academic%20major">major</a> and intends to pursue teaching. He was <a href="Canadian%20College%20Draft">drafted</a> in the <a href="2008%20CFL%20Draft">2008 CFL Draft</a> by the <a href="Toronto%20Argonauts">Toronto Argonauts</a>.
Professional career.
Scott's first game in the <a href="Canadian%20Football%20League">CFL</a> was the pre-season game against the <a href="Montreal%20Alouettes">Montreal Alouettes</a> on June 12, 2008, where he had two <a href="Reception%20%28American%20football%29">reception</a>s for 20 yards for the Argonauts. Assistant General Manager <a href="Greg%20Mohns">Greg Mohns</a> was impressed with his dedication, size, and movement. "He studied the playbook and he has not made a lot of mental mistakes," Mohns said following the first game. "He has a chance to make the final roster."
On May 27, 2010, Scott was released by the Toronto Argonauts. Scott was recently picked up by the Edmonton Eskimos on July 27, 2010, signing a two-year deal.
On June 8, 2012, during training camp, Scott collided with defensive back <a href="Rico%20Murray">Rico Murray</a> and was hospitalized. Scott has been placed on the 9-game injured list.
